ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A class about social movements in muslim-majority communities that combines both historical and contemporary lenses of analysis, with a great readings list.

a useful introduction to sociological movement theory and learning about the islamic movements you see and hear about on the news. the course is more of an introductory survey than a critical thinking or research course - perhaps useful for those new to the topic or thinking of doing further research in future years.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It gave me a good background in social movements theory, it got me so interested in the topic the t I want to pursuit studying sociology
as a historian, it was useful exposing myself to a new part of the world and new way of thinking (by sociology and social sciences approach rather than a humanities one).
